title: Netanyahu says Gaza war has entered 'second stage'
summary: Casting the war as a fight for his country's very survival, the Israeli prime minister warned Saturday that the assault would intensify ahead of a broad ground invasion into Gaza. The health ministry in the Hamas-ruled territory said early Sunday that more than 8,000 had been killed in Gaza since the start of the war.

title: South Africa beat New Zealand 12-11 to win record fourth Rugby World Cup
summary: Handre Pollard kicked four penalties to help South Africa to a nail-biting victory over 14-man New Zealand in the Rugby World Cup final on Saturday to claim a record fourth title.

title: Mexican security authorities raise Hurricane Otis death toll to 39
summary: Acapulco was struggling Saturday to recover from the extraordinarily powerful storm. The picturesque Mexican tourist haunt had never experienced a Category 5 hurricane like Otis, which roared ashore Wednesday and made local landmarks built over decades look like they had been bombed.

title: Greece painfully rebuilds its economy after 15 years of depression
summary: On Friday, S&P upgraded Greece's rating. But while the economy has been cleaned up, it remains 20% below its 2008 level and the population is still very impoverished.

title: The training camp where Ukrainians prepare for combat: 'Here, they can make mistakes'
summary: Some young civilians, who fear a mobilization will be 'inevitable,' are enrolling in paid training programs that teach them military combat skills.

title: Tyson Fury wins split decision against MMA fighter Ngannou
summary: Mixed martial arts fighter Francis Ngannou knocked Fury down in round three but the 35-year-old British fighter, though shaken, was able to continue. He remained undefeated at 34-0-1 with 24 knockouts.

title: Mike Pence ends White House campaign after struggling to gain traction
summary: Pence is the first major candidate to leave a race that has been dominated by his former boss-turned-rival, Donald Trump. His struggles underscore just how much the former president has transformed the Republican party.

title: Israel accelerates its military operations in the Gaza Strip
summary: The army claims to have carried out 150 strikes on underground infrastructures used by Hamas in the north of the Gaza Strip. The scale of attacks  remained difficult to gauge, especially as communications in the Palestinian enclave have been cut off since Friday.

title: Macron proposes a 'maritime humanitarian coalition' to help civilians in Gaza
summary: At the end of the European Council on Friday, the French president discussed the possibility of transferring patients and delivering medical supplies and food to Gaza. He assured that 'contacts' had been established with the Israeli authorities.

title: Maine mass shooting suspect found dead after two-day manhunt
summary: The man wanted in the mass shooting at a bowling alley and bar that killed 18 people and wounded 13 was found dead Friday, according to authorities, bringing an end to a search that put the entire state of Maine on edge for the last two days.

title: In French Polynesia, dog overpopulation is making residents' life miserable with bites, accidents and noise
summary: The dog population in French Polynesia is estimated at nearly 500,000, almost twice as many as the 280,000 human residents. Animal protection organizations are calling for mass sterilization campaigns for these often stray animals.

title: Russia tracks down migrants to fill its army's ranks
summary: To reinforce its troops in Ukraine, and avoid an unpopular new wave of military mobilization, the Kremlin has been arresting and deceiving foreign workers, going as far as raiding mosques for them.

title: Spanish Catholic clergy sexually abused more than 200,000 children, report estimates
summary: Presenting the findings, Spain's national ombudsman criticized the church's response to abuse and recommended the establishment of a reparation fund.

title: At least 32 dead in Kazakhstan coal mine fire
summary: Kazakhstan's President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev said on Saturday that steel giant ArcelorMittal was the 'worst' company in 'our history' after a fire at a mine owned by the Luxembourg-listed group killed more than 32 people.

title: Rugby World Cup: England defeat Argentina to finish in third place
summary: Captain Owen Farrell kicked 16 points for England as clung on to beat Argentina 26-23 on Friday.

title: Switzerland: Outspoken xenophobia gains ground at the ballot box
summary: The populist SVP party strengthened its political dominance in the October 22 federal elections, emphasizing hardline immigration. Controversial campaign rhetoric raised concerns over potential racial incitement, pushing the limits of Swiss law.

title: Wild chimpanzees also experience menopause
summary: This is a first for a wild primate. In the community of Ngogo, Uganda, females continue to live up to 10 years after the end of their fertile period, according to a study published Friday in the journal 'Science.'

title: US, China pave way for a Biden-Xi meeting next month
summary: President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping have agreed to meet on the sidelines of next month's Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in San Francisco, according to a US official familiar with the planning.

title: Turkey's centenary celebrations overshadowed by war between Israel and Hamas
summary: Often accused of wanting to replace the figure of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has prioritized support for Gaza over national celebrations. Hundreds of thousands of people attended a large rally in support of Palestine on Saturday in Istanbul.

title: 'Friends' actor Matthew Perry dies aged 54
summary: Law enforcement sources told the 'Los Angeles Times' that the star was found unresponsive in a hot tub at his Los Angeles home by first responders on Saturday. They were unable to revive him.

title: Israel warns that Gaza City is now 'a battlefield' after conducting intense bombardment over the past 24 hours
summary: No official death toll was given after Friday night's offensive that also knocked out all of Gaza's communication networks, but the level of bombardment was unprecedented since the start of the war on October 7. Le Monde followed events as they unfolded today.

title: In Poland, after their surprise victory, the democrats prepare for a tense coalition with President Duda
summary: The future majority will have to re-establish the rule of law and the country's credibility on the European stage. To be enacted, all legislative initiatives, apart from the budget vote, require the signature of the president, a member of the ultra-conservative party.

title: Striking US auto union reaches tentative deal with Stellantis
summary: The agreement reached Saturday after 44 days of strike action that simultaneously targeted Detroit's "Big Three" automakers, is similar to one struck earlier this week with Ford, the union said. GM now remains the only automaker without a tentative deal

title: On the Amazon's Rio Negro, a historic drought brings life to a standstill
summary: The Rio Negro, one of the main tributaries of the Amazon River, has reached its lowest level in 121 years. It's creating a punishing predicament in the daily lives of the people living along its banks.

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: South Africa remains on top of the world after nerve-wracking final
summary: The Springboks triumphed over New Zealand 12-11 on Saturday. A victory by the slimmest of margins, it made Siya Kolisi's team the most successful in history.

title: 'An innovative law passed in Quebec shows that ethical surrogate pregnancy can exist'
summary: Poisoned by the question of money, the French debate on surrogate pregnancy (GPA) would benefit from drawing inspiration from the law passed in June in Quebec, which guarantees that the entire process is free of charge, said anthropologist Chantal Collard and psychoanalyst Geneviève Delaisi de Parseval in an article for 'Le Monde.'

title: With the death of Matthew Perry, 'Friends' loses its Chandler Bing
summary: Deliberately funny and ironic about his own weaknesses, weakened by his addictions to alcohol and painkillers, the actor marked the cult series with his impeccable sense of comic timing. He died on October 28 at the age of 54.

title: Macron plans to make abortion an 'irreversible' constitutional right in France
summary: In an online post on Sunday, the French president said, 'In 2024, the right of women to choose abortion will become irreversible.'

title: Israel-Palestinian peace: What is the two-state solution?
summary: Israel and Palestine as two independent states, coexisting side by side − this was the principle of the Oslo Accords, signed in 1993 by then-Israeli PM Yitzhak Rabin and Yasser Arafat, former chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization. But since the agreements' failure, some consider this solution unrealistic.

title: Elon Musk, the disinformed disinformer
summary: In just one year, the Tesla and SpaceX boss has transformed Twitter into X, a social media network where fake news proliferates. But he himself is a victim of this ecosystem, with his naiveté and credulity shining through it.

title: 'The Jews of France are no more responsible for Israeli policy than the Arabs of France are for Hamas terrorism'
summary: Transposing the Israeli-Palestinian  to an already fragmented country poses a very real danger of further fuelling anti-Semitism and racism, warns columnist Philippe Bernard.
